to reduce the different forms of a word to one single form, for example, reducing "builds", "building",or "built" to the lemma "build": Compounds were lemmatized, that is, inflectional differences were disregarded. We used a lemmatised frequency list for the 8000 most frequent words in English.
More examplesFewer examplesThe word forms are lemmatised.A computer program has been developed to automatically lemmatize this list of words.We can't lemmatise "'nt" as "not" unless we have previously tokenised "'nt" as a separate unit for analysis.
